title: Commemorating the Asian-American community's celebration of the Lunar New Year, 4709, the Year of the Rabbit on February 3, 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commemorating  the  Asian-American  community's
celebration of the Lunar New Year, 4709,  the  Year  of  the  Rabbit  on
February 3, 2011

WHEREAS, With due cause and proper resolve, this Legislative Body honors
the  Asian-American  community  of  the City and State of New York as it
celebrates the Lunar New Year; and
  WHEREAS, According to legend, Buddha invited the animals of the  world
to  visit him, rewarding those who came by naming a year in their honor;
each animal in turn gave its characteristics to the people born  in  its
year; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Asian-American community joyously ushers in the Year of
the Rabbit, 4709 on February 3, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, People born in the Year of the Rabbit are talented and affec-
tionate, yet shy; they are good companions and work  well  with  people;
and
  WHEREAS,  Those  born  under  the  sign  of  the  Rabbit are noble and
elegant; they are also cautious and known for their careful and  system-
atic  thinking; they do well in their work, are intelligent in business,
and have creative minds; and
  WHEREAS, Refined, stylish and sophisticated, with impeccable  manners,
individuals  born in the Year of the Rabbit are peace-loving and gentle,
with an artistic side which demonstrates their good taste; and
  WHEREAS, The Lunar New Year, the most important and  most  popular  of
Asian festivals, exemplifies the rich and diverse cultural traditions of
Asian-Americans; and
  WHEREAS, New York is blessed with many citizens of Asian descent; they
are  distinguished  by  their  excellence and their contributions to all
fields of endeavor; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is proud to honor  all  of  New  York's
citizens  of  Asian ancestry, joining with them in welcoming the Year of
the Rabbit, 4709 on February 3, 2011; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commemorate  the auspicious occasion of the celebration of the Lunar New
Year, the Year of the Rabbit; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That copies of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to distinguished members of the Asian-American community.
